alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Martin, east central Morgan, Johnson and northeastern Magoffin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Niles, or near Salyersville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Redbush around 530 PM EDT. Barnetts Creek, Staffordsville, Fitz, Denver, Collista and Flatgap around 535 PM EDT. Paintsville, Wittensville, Thealka, Galen, Kerz, Hagerhill, Sip and Winifred around 540 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tutor Key, Nippa, Stambaugh, Bobbs, Thelma, Williamsport, Woodland Estates, Perston Estates, Meally, Buffalo, Whitehouse, River, Offutt, Boons Camp, Wells Chapel, Chestnut, Inez, Wells, Stidham, Tomahawk, Milo, Add, Pevier and Debord. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 70 and 72. Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 8 and 9. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 4 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
